channel.title: jQuery Traversing on JavaScript
channel.description: Recent content in jQuery Traversing on JavaScript

item.title: ancestors
item.description: ancestor Methods Methods used to get the ancestors of the selected element .parent() Method is used to get the direct parent of the selected element Example $(() => { $('button').click(() => { $('.box').parent().toggleClass('backgroundEffect') }) }) JS Bin on jsbin.com .parents() Method is used to get the ancestors of the selected element Example $(() => { $('button').click(() => { // this will apply the class to "all" ancestors $('.

item.title: descendants
item.description: descendant Methods .children() Method is used to get the direct children of the selected element Example $(() => { $("button").click(() => { // this will add a border bottom // to all the children of the div element (the <p> elements) $('div').children().css("border-bottom", "3px double red") }) }) JS Bin on jsbin.com .find() Method is used to get the descendant elements of the selected element

item.title: Other Traversal Methods
item.description: Other Traversal Methods There are many other traversal methods available click here to see a complete list
